history.proof: induction v. - inversion p. - hauto lq: on dep: on depth: 3.

exceptions.exn: Abstracting over the terms "n0" and "p" leads to a term fun (n1 : nat) (p0 : pos n1) => vec_change (h ## v) p0 (vec_pos (h ## v) p0) = h ## v which is ill-typed. Reason is: Illegal application: The term "vec_pos" of type "forall n : nat, vec n -> pos n -> X" cannot be applied to the terms "n1" : "nat" "h ## v" : "vec (S n)" "p0" : "pos n1" The 2nd term has type "vec (S n)" which should be coercible to "vec n1".

original: induction v. - inversion p. - destruct p. -- simpl. reflexivity. -- simpl. f_equal. apply IHv.
